Assuming that an impulse or modification is introduced at time \\( t_1 \\) influencing \\( u(t,x) \\), and subsequently the system is again transformed by Laplace transform, will the final s-domain representation \\( U(s,x) \\) of the wave at time \\( t_2 > t_1 \\) only depend on the original conditions modified by the impulse, disregarding the initial transform application at \\( t = 0 \\)?
Explanation: The final s-domain outcome not only depends on the modified conditions post-impulse but also on how the initial Laplace transform was applied, which could have altered the original state or introduced factors that persistently affect the evolution of the solution.
